commands.note:
(1) If the Pin-Code does not enabled in the SIM card, the value in the Pin-Code
column will not take effect.

fields.name: UnitID
fields.description:
The identification number of the unit. The default unit ID is
1010000001.

fields.name: NewPassword
fields.description: The new password of the unit. (Max. 4 characters)

fields.name: PINCODE
fields.description: The PIN code of the GSM/GPRS SIM card. (Max. 4 digits)

fields.name: Input1Delay
fields.description:
The de-bounce delay for positive Input 1. Default is 7 (700ms).
Max. 255 (25500ms).

fields.name: Input2Delay
fields.description:
The de-bounce delay for positive Input 2. Default is 7 (700ms).
Max. 255 (25500ms).

fields.name: Input3Delay
fields.description:
The de-bounce delay for negative Input 3. Default is 7 (700ms).
Max. 255 (25500ms).

fields.name: Input4Delay
fields.description:
The de-bounce delay for negative Input 4. Default is 7 (700ms).
Max. 255 (25500ms).

fields.name:
Disconnect GPRS
Roaming
fields.description:
0: Default
1: When X1 enters roaming status and GPRS is online, it will
cut GPRS connection automatically.

commands.description: Execute this command to set or query unit parameters

fields.name: CommType
fields.description:
Set the primary communication type.
0: Serial (Direct connect mode)
1: Reserved for CSD (Circuit Switched Data) communication
2: SMS communication
3: GPRS communication

fields.name: SMSBaseNumber
fields.description: SMS base phone number (Max. 16 digits)

fields.name: CSDBaseNumber
fields.description: CSD base phone number (Max. 16 digits)

fields.name: GPRS_APN
fields.description: GPRS Access Point Name. (Max. 35 characters)

fields.name: GPRS_Username
fields.description: GPRS login user name (Max. 15 characters)

fields.name: GPRS_Password
fields.description: GPRS login password (Max. 15 characters)

fields.name: GPRS_IPType
fields.description:
GPRS package format
0: UDP
1:TCP

fields.name: GPRS_HostAddress
fields.description:
The base station static WAN IP/DNS address.
(Max. 30 characters)

fields.name: GPRS_HostPort
fields.description:
The base station application port number of the UDP/TCP
(Please note that do not conflict with Well Known Ports)

fields.name: GPRS_SyncInterval
fields.description:
Synchronization message sending interval in seconds.
(10 ~ 65535 seconds)
0: Only one sync message be transmited when the unit
connected to the server.

fields.name: GPRS_DNS
fields.description: DNS IP address.

commands.description: Execute this command to set or query unit communication parameters.

Execute this command to ask the unit to report back current GPS positional information
to the base station.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
1:Time mode
A positional record is sent to the application when the time
elapsed since the last position sent is greater than or equal to
the time specified in parameter Time.
2:Distance mode
A positional record is sent to the application when the distance
between the current GPS position and the last position sent is
greater than or equal to the distance specified in parameter
Distance.
3:IntelliTrac mode
A positional record is sent to the application as determined by
proprietary algorithms. These algorithms attempt to minimize
the amount of data sent back to the application while
maintaining a high degree of map replay accuracy.
5: Time + ACC ON mode
If ACC is off, the tracking function will be stopped.
6: Distance + ACC ON mode
If ACC is off, the tracking function will be stopped.
7: IntelliTrac + ACC ON mode
If ACC is off, the tracking function will be stopped.

fields.name: Time
fields.description:
Specify elapsed time. The time specified is in seconds and can
be any number from 0 to 65535 seconds. Only whole numbers
can be used. The minimum time interval in SMS mode is 15
seconds, CSD/GPRS mode is 5 seconds, and Direct
Connection is 1 second.

fields.name: Distance
fields.description:
Specify elapsed distance. The distance specified is in meters
and can be any number from 0 to 65535 meters. Only whole
numbers can be used. The minimum distance interval in SMS
mode is 300 meters, CSD/GPRS mode is 100 meters, and
Direct Connection is 15 meters.

fields.name: Times
fields.description:
Specify total tracking times. The range is from 0 to 65535. If
Times=0, it means forever tracking.

data: 0: Ignore no GPS signal tracking report.
fields.name: Basis
fields.description:
0: Ignore no GPS signal tracking report.
1: Continuously tracking regardless of GPS signal.

fields.name: CommType
fields.description:
0: Serial Port
1: CS Data
2: SMS
3: GPRS

commands.description:
Tracking the unit continuously
Description Execute this command to ask the unit to report back current GPS positional
information to the control center according to the tracking mode parameter.

Stop tracking the unit
Description Execute this command to ask the unit stop reporting tracking positions to the base
station.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
1: Time mode
A positional record is sent to the application when the time
elapsed since the last position sent is greater than or equal to
the time specified in parameter Time Min 1 seconds; Max.
65535 seconds.
2: Distance mode
A positional record is sent to the application when the distance
between the current GPS position and the last position sent is
greater than or equal to the distance specified in parameter
Distance. Max. 15 meters; Max. 65535 meters.
3: IntelliTrac mode
A positional record is sent to the application as determined by
proprietary algorithms. These algorithms attempt to minimize
the amount of data sent back to the application while
maintaining a high degree of map replay accuracy.
5: Time + ACC ON mode
If ACC is off, the logging function will be stopped.
6: Distance + ACC ON mode
If ACC is off, the logging function will be stopped.
7: IntelliTrac + ACC ON mode
If ACC is off, the logging function will be stopped.

fields.name: Time
fields.description:
Specify elapsed time. The time specified is in seconds and can
be any number from 1 to 65535 seconds. Only whole numbers
can be used.

fields.name: Distance
fields.description:
Specify elapsed distance. The distance specified is in meters
and can be any number from 15 to 65535 meters. Only whole
numbers can be used.

fields.name: Times
fields.description:
Specify total Logging times. The range is from 0 to 65535. If
Times=0, it means forever logging.

data: 0: Ignore no GPS signal logging report.
fields.name: Basis
fields.description:
0: Ignore no GPS signal logging report.
1: Continuously logging regardless of GPS signal.

commands.description:
Set/Read default logging parameters
Description Execute this command to start recording current GPS positional information to the
non-volatile memory of the unit according to the logging mode parameter.

Stop default logging function
Description Execute this command to stop default logging.

Clear all default logging data
Description Execute this command to clear all default logging data.

Download logging data from the unit.
Description Execute this command to download all logging data from the unit.

fields.name: StartDateTime
fields.description:
The year, month, day, hour, minute and second of the starting
date time in GMT.

fields.name: EndDateTime
fields.description:
The year, month, day, hour, minute and second of the ending
date time in GMT.

commands.description:
Selective download logging data from the unit.
Description Execute this command to download all logging data from the unit.

Stop download logging data from the unit.
Description Execute this command to stop download all logging data from the unit.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
0: Turn off backup battery
1: Turn on backup battery

commands.description:
Set/Read backup battery parameters
Description Execute this command to set or query backup battery status. When backup battery
voltage is lower than 3.7V, a backup battery low report will be sent to the base station.
When backup battery voltage is lower than 3.4V, the unit will be shut down
automatically to avoid battery over discharge.

commands.label: Output

fields.name: OutputID
fields.description:
The unit hardware output number. Outputs are numbered 1
though 4.

fields.name: OutputControl
fields.description:
0: Set output inactive
1: Set output active

fields.name: Duration
fields.description:
Unit of duration is 100 milliseconds. Ex: if want to setup
duration for 2 seconds, you have to give a 20 value. (Min. 1=
0.1 second; Max. 255 = 25.5 seconds)

fields.name: ToggleTimes
fields.description:
The times from its current state to its alternate state and back
again. Min. 1 times; Max. 255 times

commands.description:
Set outputs state
Description Execute this command to set outputs state.

Reboot the unit
Description Execute this command to reboot the unit

fields.name: Band
fields.description:
Reset the unit to the specific mobile frequency band
0: EGSM/DCS (900/1800MHz)
1: EGSM/PCS (900/1900MHz)

commands.description:
Reset all parameters to the manufactory default
Description Execute this command to reset the unit. After resetting the unit, the previous upload
parameters will be cleared. Include phone numbers, user reports and logging
data…etc.

fields.name: Report Polling Mask
fields.description:
Specify which default report will be used for real time reporting.
Default is all reports will be used. (Report Polling Mask=255)
Bitwise operation (0: Off, 1: On)
Bit0: Input1 state changed report
Bit1: Input2 state changed report
Bit2: Input3 state changed report
Bit3: Input4 state changed report
Bit4: Main power low report
Bit5: Main power destroyed report
Bit6: Backup battery low report
Bit7: GPS destroyed report

fields.name: Report Logging Mask
fields.description:
Specify which default report will be used for logging report.
Default is all reports will be used. (Report Logging Mask=255)
Bitwise operation (0: Off, 1: On)
Bit0: Input1 state changed report
Bit1: Input2 state changed report
Bit2: Input3 state changed report
Bit3: Input4 state changed report
Bit4: Main power low report
Bit5: Main power destroyed report
Bit6: Backup battery low report
Bit7: GPS destroyed report

commands.description:
Set/Read default report mask
Description Execute this command to set or query default report mask.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: InputMask
fields.description:
This parameter defines which inputs to be the condition. One or
more inputs can be specificed in this parameter.

fields.name: InputControl
fields.description:
Defines how the inputs specificed in parameter InputMask are
considered during processing. The bit value of 0 means OFF
and 1 means ON.

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description:
The longitude of the circle zone. If zone condition is not used,
left this field empty.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description:
The latitude of the circle zone. If zone condition is not used, left
this field empty.

fields.name: ZoneTolerence
fields.description:
The radius of the circle zone in meters. If zone condition is not
used, left this field empty. (50..65535) meters

fields.name: ZoneControl
fields.description:
Defines how the geographic zone specificed in parameter
ZoneID is considered during report processing. If zone
condition is not used, left this field empty.
0: Disable zone
1: Entering the Zone
The report initiates defined actions when the current (valid)
GPS position transitions from outside the zone to inside of the
zone boundaries.
2: Exiting the Zone
The report initiates defined actions when the current (valid)
GPS position transitions from inside the zone to outside of the
zone boundaries.
3: Inside the Zone
The report initiates defined actions when the current (valid)
GPS position is within the specified zone boundaries.
4: Outside the Zone
The report initiates defined actions when the current (valid)
GPS is outside of the specified zone boundaries

fields.name: ReportAction
fields.description:
This parameter defines the actions to be taken once the report
is in an active state. One or more actions can be specified on
any report. The following list defines all available action types:
1: Logging
When all defined report conditions are true, log the most recent
GPS position to non-volatile flash memory for future retrieval.
2: Polling
When all defined report conditions are true, send the latest
GPS position to the remote base station.
3:Logging + polling
When all defined report conditions are true, log the most recent
GPS position to non-volatile flash memory and send the latest
GPS position to the remote base station.
4: Set Output
When all defined report conditions are true, set the output relay.
5: Logging + Set output
When all defined conditions are true, log the most recent GPS
position to non-volatile flash memory and set the output relay.
6. Polling + Set Output
When all defined conditions are true, send the latest GPS
position to the remote base station and set the output relay.
7. Logging + Polling + Set Output
When all defined conditions are true, log the most recent GPS
position to non-volatile flash memory, send the latest GPS
position to the remote base station, and set the output relay

fields.name: OutputID
fields.description:
The outputs are numbered through 1 to 4. This parameter is
used in conjunction with parameter ReportAction=4(Set
Output). A value 0 means ignore output control

fields.name: OutputControl
fields.description:
Defines how the output specified in parameter OutputID is
controlled while the report is active. 0:OFF 1:ON

commands.description:
Set/Read user defined report
Description Execute this command to set or query user defined report parameters.

Clear the user defined reports
Description Execute this command to clear all of the user defined reports.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
Enable power saving mode.
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: LowVoltage
fields.description:
If the vehicle battery voltage is below the LowVoltage, unit will
send a alarm message to the control center. The default voltage
value is 12.0 volts.

fields.name: GSMState
fields.description:
Set GSM status when unit enter power saving mode.
0: GSM OFF
1: GSM ON

fields.name: GPSState
fields.description:
Set GPS status when unit enter power saving mode.
0: GPS OFF
1: GPS ON

fields.name: PowerDownDelay
fields.description:
After ACC off for the delay time, the unit will go into power
saving mode. (0..65535 seconds)
When SleepPriority = 1, the minimum value of
PowerDownDelay is 180.
When SleepPriority = 0, the minimum value of
PowerDownDelay is 0.

fields.name: PowerUpDuration
fields.description: Full power duration after alarm triggered. (180..65535 seconds)

fields.name: SleepPriority
fields.description:
Enable priority sleep mode.
0: Disable
Unit will finish executing the tracking command such as number
of tracking times, then goes to sleeping mode.
1: Enable
Unit will be forced to enter sleep mode regardless of any
tracking command in progress.

commands.description:
Set/Read power management parameters of the unit.
Description Execute this command to setup or query the power management parameters of the
unit. If the power saving mode is enabled, all the power saving features will be
triggered by ACC (Input1).

Read telephone IMEI number
Description Execute this command to read the IMEI (International Mobile station Equipment
Identity) of the unit.

fields.name: PhoneNumber
fields.description: The specific phone number for unit to dial up.

commands.description:
Voice wiretap / monitoring
Description Execute this command to wiretap the voice conversation inside the car. When the unit
receives this command, the unit will call out to the specific phone number
automatically.

fields.name: Enable/Disable
fields.description:
Enable vehicle towed function
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: SatelliteUsed
fields.description: Minimum GPS satellites reception. (0..16)

fields.name: MinSpeed
fields.description: Minimun vehicle speed. (0..65535) Km/h

fields.name: MaxSpeed
fields.description: Maximum vehicle speed. (0..65535) Km/h

fields.name: Duration
fields.description:
The time duration after satelliteUsed, MinSpeed and MaxSpeed
conditions are true. (0..65535 seconds)

commands.description:
Enable/Disable vehicle towed function
Description Execute this command set/read vehicle towed parameters. The vehicle towed report
will be sent to the base station when ACC (Input1) OFF and vehicle speed between
MinSpeed and MaxSpeed for a Duration time.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
Enable mileage accumulator function. If mileage function is
enabled, the current mileage will be added to the end of each
report position.
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: InitialMileage
fields.description: Set initial mileage (0.0 ~ 4294967.0) Km

commands.description:
Enable/Disable mileage accumulator function
Description Execute this command set/read mileage accumulator function.

fields.name: Result
fields.description:
The test result code is a decimal value.
0: No Error
1: GPS Failed
2: GSM Failed
4: EEPROM Failed
8: SRAM Failed
16: Backup battery failed
64: Modem failed
128: Burn-in test failed

fields.name: MainPowerVoltage
fields.description: This field indicates main power source voltage.

fields.name: BatteryVoltage
fields.description:
This field indicates backup battery voltage. The backup battery must be turned ON
(Refer to $ST+BBCTRL command) before excute this command. If the backup
battery voltage is lower than 3.6V, it means the backup battery is empty or damage.

fields.name: SystemCode
fields.description:
The system current status code. This system code is only for
manufactory reference purpose.

commands.description:
Unit hardware diagnostic
Description Execute this command to process unit hardware diagnostic.

Get the firmware version of the unit.
Description Execute this command to query firmware version of the unit.

fields.name: BaudRateID
fields.description:
Serial port baudrate ID
0: 1200bps
1: 2400bps
2: 4800bps
3: 9600bps
4: 19200bps
5: 38400bps
6: 57600bps (Serial port default)

commands.description:
Set/Read baudrate of serial port
Description Execute this command to set/read the baudrate parameter of the serial port. This
command only supported for serial configuration.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Enable

commands.description:
Enable/Disable GPS NMEA string output
Description Execute this command to enable or disable GPS NMEA string output. Currently, this
function only supported $GPRMC string output and serial port baud rate must be
2400bps at least.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
Enable speeding report
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: ReportAction
fields.description:
This parameter defines the actions to be taken once the speeding
report is in an active state. One or more actions can be specified
on this report. The following list defines all available action types:
1:Logging
When all defined report conditions are true, log the most recent
GPS position to non-volatile flash memory for future retrieval.
2:Polling
When all defined report conditions are true, send the latest GPS
position to the remote base station.
3:Logging and Polling:
When all defined report conditions are true, the unit will do
following:
A. Log the most recent GPS position to non-volatile flash
memory for future retrieval.
B. Send the latest GPS position to the remote base station.
4. Set Output:
When all defined conditions are true, it set the state of the
assigned output port number. When any defined condition
becomes false, the assigned output port number backs to the
original state.
5. Logging + Set Output:
When all defined conditions are true, log the most recent GPS
position to non-volatile flash memory and set the state of the
assigned output port number. When any defined condition
becomes false, the assigned output port number backs to the
original state.
6. Polling + Set Output:
When all defined conditions are true, send the latest GPS position
to the remote base station set the state of the assigned output port
number. When any defined condition becomes false, the assigned
output port number backs to the original state.
ReportAction
7. Logging + Polling + Set Output:
When all defined conditions are true, log the most recent
GPS position to non-volatile flash memory, send the most
recent GPS position to the remote base station, and set the
state of the assigned output port number. When any defined
condition becomes false, the assigned output port number
backs to the original state.

fields.name: MinSpeed
fields.description:
The minimum speed of speed range
(0 – 255 km/h)

fields.name: MaxSpeed
fields.description:
The maximum speed of speed range
(0 – 255 km/h)

fields.name: Duration
fields.description:
his parameter defines the speeding report will be actived once the
speed range is satisfied for a time duration. Valid value for logging
and polling is following:
Logging: 1~65535 seconds
Polling: 15~65535 seconds
Logging + Polling: 15~65535 seconds.

fields.name: Output ID
fields.description:
The unit hardware output number. Outputs are numbered 1
through 4.

fields.name: Output Control
fields.description:
0 Set output inactive.
1 Set output active.

The time for report. The format is hour, minute and second.

fields.name: DateTime
fields.description: YYYYMMDDhhmmss (GMT Date and Time)﹒

fields.name: Lac
fields.description: Location area code

fields.name: Cell ID
fields.description: Cell ID

Get the location area code
Description
Execute this command to query Location information.

fields.name: Reset
fields.description:
0: No Reset
1: Reset all counter

commands.description:
Counter record
Description
Execute this command to query four counter.One for the number of reboot, one for the total number of GPRS connection attempt, one for the number of GPRS connection failed, one for the total number of GPRS connection with the server.

fields.name: Enable
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: Report Mode
fields.description:
1: Logging:
When all defined report conditions are true, log the most recent GPS position to non-volatile flash memory for future retrieval.
2:Polling: When all defined report conditions are true, send the latest GPS position to the remote base station.
3:Logging and Polling: When all defined report conditions are true, the unit will do following: a. Log the most recent GPS position to non-volatile flash memory for future retrieval. b. Send the latest GPS position to the remote base station.

fields.name: Idle Speed
fields.description: Idle speed (0-65535 km/hr)

fields.name: Duration
fields.description: the duration of idle time ( 1-65535 min)

commands.description:
Calculate the idle time.
Description
Execute this command to accumulate the total Idle time in which the ACC is on but the
GPS speed is less than pre-defined interval for a certain time. The “Report ID 60” & the “Report ID 61” will be the used for this command:
Report ID 60: The idle starts event.
Report ID 61: The idle ends event.
The time difference of the “Time of report ID 61” and the “time of the ID 60” is the time
period of the IDLE event. The total idle time for a trip could
